summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of a woman (name redacted) who describes meeting Jeffrey Epstein while in high school, visiting his New York residence approximately nine times between 2004-2005 for massages that involved sexual abuse, and receiving payment from his staff. She mentions Ghislaine Maxwell was present at the residence on two occasions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. The interviewee describes visiting his New York residence for massages that escalated to sexual abuse when she was 16-17 years old.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney present during the interviewee's FBI interview via video conference.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: Attorney present during the interviewee's FBI interview via video conference.

persons.name: John Cuti
persons.context: Attorney present during the interviewee's FBI interview via video conference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Seen by the interviewee at Epstein's New York house on two occasions. On the first occasion, Maxwell was talking to another unknown girl.

persons.name: Lesley
persons.context: Called the interviewee the majority of the times to schedule appointments with Epstein. Never asked the interviewee's age.

connections.description: Maxwell was present at Epstein's New York residence on occasions when the interviewee was there.
Lesley acted as a scheduler, calling girls to arrange appointments for massages with Epstein at his residence.
Allred was an attorney representing a victim (the interviewee) during her FBI interview about Epstein.

events.title: First visits to Epstein's residence
events.description: The interviewee, then in high school, begins visiting Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence for massages, which involved sexual abuse. She was introduced by a friend.

events.title: Series of massage appointments
events.description: The interviewee visited Epstein's residence approximately nine times over this period. The routine involved massages that escalated, with Epstein becoming physically aggressive. She was paid $200-$350 per visit.

events.title: FBI Interview of Victim
events.description: The interviewee provides a statement to the FBI via video conference, detailing her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein, with her attorneys present.

locations: Manhattan, New York (interviewee's birthplace and upbringing)
71st Street or 73rd Street near 5th Avenue, near the park (location of Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence)
keyFacts: The interviewee was 16-17 years old and in high school when she began visiting Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence for massages that involved sexual abuse.
Epstein's staff, including Lesley and a Filipino cleaning lady, facilitated the appointments and payments ($200-$350 per visit), and were aware the girls were young and in school.
Ghislaine Maxwell was present at Epstein's residence on at least two occasions witnessed by the interviewee.
The interviewee stopped visiting Epstein around age 18 due to her partner's objections, but Epstein's staff continued to call her for about a month or two afterward.
This appears to be the first time the interviewee spoke to law enforcement about her experiences with Epstein.
